summary: Email chain between U.S. Department of Justice officials discussing coordination with UK authorities regarding a potential witness in the SDNY investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails focus on obtaining approval to share witness information with UK police (Met Police) and logistical details for interviewing a UK national who reported past abuse by Epstein.

persons.name: John T. McNeil
persons.role: U.S. Department of Justice Attach√© - London
persons.context: DOJ official based in London coordinating with UK authorities regarding a witness in the SDNY Epstein investigation, discussing approval to share witness information with Met Police.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator of past abuse reported by a potential witness in the UK, central subject of the SDNY investigation.

connections.description: McNeil is involved in coordinating investigation activities related to Epstein's alleged crimes, specifically regarding a witness in the UK.

events.title: Coordination on UK witness
events.description: Email discussion about obtaining OIA approval to share information about a UK witness with Met Police, including questions about witness nationality, location of abuse, and prior police reports.

events.title: Scheduled call about investigation
events.description: Planning of a conference call to discuss the SDNY investigation and witness coordination with UK authorities.

keyFacts: A UK national witness in England recently made a statement to Met Police reporting past abuse by Jeffrey Epstein.
SDNY investigators were preparing travel paperwork and seeking to interview this witness but had not yet done so.
DOJ officials were coordinating with UK authorities to determine if sharing the witness's identity with Met Police was necessary and legally appropriate.
The emails discuss legal considerations including whether the alleged conduct constituted a UK crime based on victim nationality, location of abuse, and age of victim.
The correspondence shows ongoing international coordination between US and UK law enforcement regarding Epstein-related investigations in September 2020.
